pageContext.claim: “I would be willing to release it, subject to Congress, and use that as stimulus money, and it would go right to the American people. So we have $300 billion sitting in an account that we didn't need because things are going so well with the economy.”
pageContext.analysis: The White House told Bloomberg that Trump was referring to a $450 billion fund to support emergency lending programs created by the Federal Reserve. Bloomberg reported “about half” of the fund has been committed, which means roughly $225 billion — not $300 could be reallocated.
